posts.name: Jason
posts.cooked:
Recently our team made the decision to switch to Limelights- so we bought 2 Limelight 3As we are attempting to set-up. After some initial troubleshooting we discovered the 3A is meant for FTC so the online Limelight guide for FRC has some wrong information (We don’t have to flash or connect via Ethernet). We’re currently using our Crescendo robot’s RoboRio connected with a USB to one of the Limelights and attempted to port-forward the limelight here but with no success as the limelight won’t even show up as available in the Network Table portion of Shuffleboard.

Was wondering if anyone else had any experience with setting up the Limelight 3A for FRC before as it would be very useful for our team for robot localization. Any help is appreciated, thanks!

link_counts.title: Added network table and portforwarding to try to get limelight in shu… · 6500gearcats/Reefscape2025@a524c5e · GitHub

posts.name: Brandon_Hjelstrom
posts.cooked:
Hi Jason,

Have you configured the team number in the 3A settings page? Your 3As should work as long as the configured team number matches that of the roboRIO.

posts.name: Jason
posts.cooked: I could triple check this tomorrow but I’m fairly certain we went into the Limelight 3A’s “ http://limelight.local:5801 ” and changed the team number to 6500. Any other things I could look into?

posts.name: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons
posts.cooked: It MAY only work with one 3A…that second one may be throwing errors on your system.  Of course I am presuming that you are using both with this statement.
posts.display_username: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons

posts.name: Jason
posts.cooked: Sorry for the confusion- we are just using 1 Limelight 3A in this scenario but intend to use 2 down the road (if we can get one working)

Jason81:

posts.name: Jason
posts.cooked:
Just a little update that we connected to the limelight 3A through USB to the laptop and confirmed that the team number is set to 6500 and the IP is “10.65.0.11” in this screenshot IMG_8426 1920×1440 225 KB but are still experiencing the same problems (no limelight showing up in shuffleboard network tables or updating their values). One little note is that we are able to access the video stream for a limelight for a few seconds while it’s connected to the roborio through the url “10.65.0.2:5800” however it quickly stops responding after a second or two and the other url “10.65.0.2:5801” continually loads.

IMG_8426 1920×1440 225 KB

IMG_8426 1920×1440 225 KB

posts.name: NewAmazingPVP
posts.cooked: Hey there, were you able to figure out a solution to this? We were thinking of investing in Limelight 3A for FRC , but we just need to be sure it works as intended. We are technically out of USB ports on the RoboRio, so we might probably use a USB hub if possible. I am curious, is it possible to use a USB-to-Ethernet converter and connect the limelight 3a to a network switch/radio instead? Probably wouldn’t work, but just an idea.

Also thinking about this. Possibly a POE to USB-C converter could work for the main issue of the usb being for both network and power. In terms of having 2, I am looking at using a 2+ as the other LL and it is usually possible to have multiple regulars, so unless someone has contradictory information in that regard, this should be possible, right?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.name: Brandon_Hjelstrom
posts.cooked:
image 1798×1162 112 KB

image 1798×1162 112 KB

image 1798×1162 112 KB

We have 3As working on RIOs with 2025 software here - make sure the “Custom NT Server IP” address is 0.0.0.0. Also make sure you are setting the team number and not the usb index.

You can confirm functionality by checking glass:

image 738×576 74.1 KB

image 738×576 74.1 KB

image 738×576 74.1 KB

posts.name: Jason
posts.cooked:
Can confirm we eventually got this working on our team, I appreciate the response. I’m assuming it had to do with us changing the Custom NT Server IP to 10.65.0.1.1 as we were able to see the limelight 3A in NT/Glass after changing the configuration to 0.0.0.0 like recommended. We even got 2 Limelight 3As posting at the same time by changing the USB Index in configuration and using different hostnames.

It would’ve helped for some documentation for the 3A specifically for FRC in the future because the process is just so different, but I’m glad we got it working.
How do you recommend wiring 3As for FRC ?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.name: Caden R Dalley
posts.cooked: Is it possible to view the Limelight 3A camera stream through a dashboard such as Elastic?

I have data being published to NT by the 3A but I can’t access the configuration page when It’s plugged into the Rio. I can access the configuration page when it’s plugged into my computer though. Do you know any reasons why this might be happening? Am I supposed to access the configuration page through a certain IP?

posts.name: Derek W.
posts.cooked: Did you ever get this resolved? We had to quickly switch to 3As, but are having issues with this as well as accessing the video streams. Both are posting to NetworkTables just fine though.
I haven’t been able to resolve these issues yet.

posts.name: JacobD
posts.cooked: The 3A doesn’t have a network video stream like the other limelights do since it communicates over USB rather than ethernet. It only supports networktables data streams to rio natively.

posts.name: Derek W.
posts.cooked: But you can use the PortForwarder from wpinet to forward the 3A’s to your Driver Station. Then you just point a browser tot he roborio at the specified port and you can see the streams.
